Message.Title: Revenues to profits is very difficult.
Message.Msg: I've been telling people for years that current revenues do not translate to future profits. The primary reason is that no one can predict the future. New competition, regulations, innovations, etc affect future profit potential. So for Investors to use revenue as a basis for valuation is nuts. Example: Microsoft is driving down cloud pricing.

Topic.Title: More option tradering crackheadz will be murdered

Message.Msg: Not if you’re a seller of options. You can make money selling CALLS on over-priced stocks because people tend to extrapolate stock charts even though the current stock price already has the future growth priced into it. People see a stock doubling in a year, and they think it might double again the following year, but it never does.

Topic.Title: More option tradering crackheadz will be murdered
